Butter, Ghee, or Oil: What's a Healthier Choice?

Understanding the Choices

When it comes to cooking fats, the options of butter, ghee, and oil often leave us pondering which is the healthier choice. Let's break down these culinary fats to help you make an informed decision.

Butter:
  • Pros: Rich in flavor, contains essential nutrients like Vitamin A.
  • Cons: High in saturated fats, may contribute to elevated cholesterol levels.
Ghee:
  • Pros: Clarified form of butter, lower in lactose and casein, rich in fat-soluble vitamins.
  • Cons: Still a saturated fat, so moderation is key.
Oil:
  • Pros: Comes in various types (olive oil, canola oil, etc.), each with distinct health benefits.
  • Cons: Depending on the type, some oils may be high in saturated or trans fats.

Health Considerations

  • Heart Health: While all three options can be part of a balanced diet, moderation is crucial. Opt for unsaturated fats, such as those found in olive oil, for heart health.

  • Dietary Restrictions: Ghee is a popular choice for individuals with lactose intolerance as it is clarified to remove milk solids.

  • Cooking Temperatures: Each fat has a different smoke point. Ghee and refined oils are suitable for high-temperature cooking, while butter may burn at higher heats.

5 Key Reasons to Switch to Ghee Today

1. Nutrient-Rich Profile

Ghee is not just a flavorful addition to your meals; it also packs a nutrient punch. Rich in fat-soluble vitamins like A, E, and D, ghee contributes to overall well-being.

2. Lactose-Free Alternative

For individuals with lactose intolerance, ghee offers the delightful taste of butter without the discomfort. The clarification process removes lactose and casein, making it a suitable substitute.

3. High Smoke Point

Ghee's high smoke point makes it ideal for various cooking methods, including frying and sautéing. Unlike some oils, ghee maintains its integrity at higher temperatures.

4. Supports Digestive Health

Ayurveda, the ancient Indian system of medicine, considers ghee a digestive aid. It is believed to lubricate the digestive tract and promote a healthy gut.

5. Rich Flavor Enhancement

Ghee not only imparts a rich and nutty flavor to dishes but also enhances the taste of spices and herbs. Its versatility makes it a favorite among chefs and home cooks alike.

categories.under_footer_seo:
Fresh Vegetables

Discover the goodness of our handpicked fresh vegetables that not only add flavor to your meals but also offer a plethora of health benefits.

Health Benefits of Our Top Fresh Vegetables:

Buy Fresh Tomatoes online in Pakistan

Tomatoes are rich in antioxidants like lycopene, which may contribute to heart health and reduce the risk of certain cancers. Include tomatoes in your diet for a burst of flavor and nutritional benefits.

Buy Fresh Onions online in Pakistan

Onions are not just for adding flavor to your dishes; they also provide health benefits. They contain antioxidants and compounds that may help reduce inflammation and promote heart health.

Buy Fresh Potatoes online in Pakistan

Potatoes are a versatile vegetable that can be part of a healthy diet. They are a good source of vitamins and minerals, especially potassium. Enjoy them in various dishes for a satisfying and nutritious meal.

Quick and Easy Recipes:

Quick Tomato Salad

Ingredients:

  • Fresh tomatoes
  • Cucumber
  • Red onion
  • Feta cheese
  • Olive oil
  • Fresh basil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Chop tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion into bite-sized pieces.
  2. Combine in a bowl, add crumbled feta cheese.
  3. Drizzle with olive oil, add chopped fresh basil, and season with salt and pepper.
  4. Toss gently and enjoy a refreshing tomato salad!

Caramelized Onion Dip

Ingredients:

  • Caramelized onions
  • Sour cream
  • Mayonnaise
  • Garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Mix caramelized onions, sour cream, mayonnaise, and garlic powder in a bowl.
  2. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. Chill in the refrigerator for an hour and serve with your favorite chips or veggies.
  4. Enjoy a delicious caramelized onion dip!

Roasted Potato Wedges

Ingredients:

  • Potatoes
  • Olive oil
  • Garlic powder
  • Paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
  2. Cut potatoes into wedges and toss with olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
  3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast until golden and crispy.
  4. Serve hot as a delicious side or snack!

Type of Shampoos

Shampoo for Dry and Damaged Hair

Shampoo for dry and damaged hair is formulated to target excessive dryness and damage by providing extra moisture and nourishment. This type of shampoo often uses ingredients that are rich in vitamins, amino acids, minerals and oils to help repair the hair strands back to health. Additionally, these shampoos are free of harsh chemicals or sulfates that can further weaken already fragile strands. The result is smoother, softer, shinier hair with improved manageability.

Shampoo for Oily Hair and Scalp

Shampoo for oily hair is specially formulated to help reduce excess oil and sebum on the scalp. It uses ingredients that help break down the oil, while gently cleansing away dirt and impurities. It also helps unclog hair follicles, which can be a source of greasiness. Additionally, it contains balancing agents that help regulate the production of sebum on the scalp to prevent over-producing oils in the future. This type of shampoo works to leave your hair refreshed without stripping away its natural moisture or leaving behind a heavy residue.

Butter, Ghee, or Oil: What's a Healthier Choice?

Understanding the Choices

When it comes to cooking fats, the options of butter, ghee, and oil often leave us pondering which is the healthier choice. Let's break down these culinary fats to help you make an informed decision.

Butter:
  • Pros: Rich in flavor, contains essential nutrients like Vitamin A.
  • Cons: High in saturated fats, may contribute to elevated cholesterol levels.
Ghee:
  • Pros: Clarified form of butter, lower in lactose and casein, rich in fat-soluble vitamins.
  • Cons: Still a saturated fat, so moderation is key.
Oil:
  • Pros: Comes in various types (olive oil, canola oil, etc.), each with distinct health benefits.
  • Cons: Depending on the type, some oils may be high in saturated or trans fats.

Health Considerations

  • Heart Health: While all three options can be part of a balanced diet, moderation is crucial. Opt for unsaturated fats, such as those found in olive oil, for heart health.

  • Dietary Restrictions: Ghee is a popular choice for individuals with lactose intolerance as it is clarified to remove milk solids.

  • Cooking Temperatures: Each fat has a different smoke point. Ghee and refined oils are suitable for high-temperature cooking, while butter may burn at higher heats.

5 Key Reasons to Switch to Ghee Today

1. Nutrient-Rich Profile

Ghee is not just a flavorful addition to your meals; it also packs a nutrient punch. Rich in fat-soluble vitamins like A, E, and D, ghee contributes to overall well-being.

2. Lactose-Free Alternative

For individuals with lactose intolerance, ghee offers the delightful taste of butter without the discomfort. The clarification process removes lactose and casein, making it a suitable substitute.

3. High Smoke Point

Ghee's high smoke point makes it ideal for various cooking methods, including frying and sautéing. Unlike some oils, ghee maintains its integrity at higher temperatures.

4. Supports Digestive Health

Ayurveda, the ancient Indian system of medicine, considers ghee a digestive aid. It is believed to lubricate the digestive tract and promote a healthy gut.

5. Rich Flavor Enhancement

Ghee not only imparts a rich and nutty flavor to dishes but also enhances the taste of spices and herbs. Its versatility makes it a favorite among chefs and home cooks alike.

Buy Fresh Potatoes online in Pakistan

Potatoes are a versatile vegetable that can be part of a healthy diet. They are a good source of vitamins and minerals, especially potassium. Enjoy them in various dishes for a satisfying and nutritious meal.

Quick and Easy Recipes:

Quick Tomato Salad

Ingredients:

  • Fresh tomatoes
  • Cucumber
  • Red onion
  • Feta cheese
  • Olive oil
  • Fresh basil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Chop tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion into bite-sized pieces.
  2. Combine in a bowl, add crumbled feta cheese.
  3. Drizzle with olive oil, add chopped fresh basil, and season with salt and pepper.
  4. Toss gently and enjoy a refreshing tomato salad!

Caramelized Onion Dip

Ingredients:

  • Caramelized onions
  • Sour cream
  • Mayonnaise
  • Garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Mix caramelized onions, sour cream, mayonnaise, and garlic powder in a bowl.
  2. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. Chill in the refrigerator for an hour and serve with your favorite chips or veggies.
  4. Enjoy a delicious caramelized onion dip!

Roasted Potato Wedges

Ingredients:

  • Potatoes
  • Olive oil
  • Garlic powder
  • Paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
  2. Cut potatoes into wedges and toss with olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
  3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast until golden and crispy.
  4. Serve hot as a delicious side or snack!

Online Mobiles (Smartphones) Shopping in Pakistan

Mobile phones (smartphones) have evolved into a necessity for everyday life all across the world. For us Pakistanis, we cannot fathom a day without smartphones as our dependence grows day by day on these handheld technological marvels. 

Pakistan has a forecasted mobile penetration rate (as a share of population) to be 51% for 2020, with a subscription growth rate of almost 3.8%. This is with credit to cheaper smartphones being easily available across the country. This fact coupled with 34% penetration of 3G/4G networks in our population proves that there is a massive smartphone market in Pakistan that is also engaged actively with the internet. 

Online Shopping: Mobiles at Metro-Online

Metro"s vast geographic presence has contributed greatly to the ease of availability of quality smartphones and services to all major cities of Pakistan. With Metro-Online, you can now browse and order your favorite smartphones from the app or website at your convenience and have them delivered anywhere across Pakistan.   

Range of Smartphone Brands Available

Metro-Online offers a wide array of mobile phone brands that cater to your specific needs. We offer high-end, mid-tier and low-end phones that are guaranteed to be delivered in prime condition to you.  

A few brands we offer in the mid and high-tier category are as follows: 

Samsung: 

Arguably the best known and received smartphone brand internationally, Samsung has established a strong foothold in Pakistan with almost 40% market share of Pakistan"s smartphone market. Samsung continues to deliver quality smartphones, offering the best-in-class displays and cameras through its vast offering of mid and high tier phones. Some of Samsung"s hot sellers have been the A and J series in 2017-2018 while the A series has presently dominated the market by its affordability and utility on offer.  

Oppo: 

Fast rising as one of Pakistan"s preeminent brands, Oppo has also established itself as a key player in the global mobile phone industry. It stands at almost 10% market share in Pakistan and continues to grow through its diverse offering of mid and high end phones.  

Honor: 

Another key player in Pakistan, Honor has continued to dominate the low and mid tier mobile phones market in Pakistan through its simple design and minimalistic UI. Presently, Honor continues to be perceived as a value brand that offers high value for the low price point.   

Xiaomi (Mi) 

One of the most prominent chinese smartphone and accessory brands in the world, Xiaomi Mi phones have developed a strong position in Pakistan in a very short span of time. Through its powerful smartphone units and modern design that is on par with its high-end counterparts, Xiaomi Mi is a must-have brand for casual and serious smartphone enthusiasts across Pakistan. Realme Another successful Chinese smartphone and accessory manufacturer, Realme has successfully managed to develop its niche of high performance mid-tier smartphones in Pakistan. Using Snapdragon processors, high RAM, and multiple cameras in its smartphones, Realme has blurred the line between "premium" and "mid-range" phones.    

Condor Mobile:

An Algerian brand that gained local prominence in a short span of time, Condor has entered the Pakistani mobiles market recently and offered quality smartphones at an extremely affordable price point that is even at times below PKR 10,000. Phones capable with regards to their RAM and ROM and large battery life are a common offering courtesy of Condor.  

Tecno Mobile 

Another prominent Chinese manufacturer, Tecno mobile offers budget smartphones that are up to date with modern speficications. Tecno has prominence in South Asia and African markets and continues to grow in awareness and market share in Pakistan.

Shampoo for Dry and Damaged Hair

Shampoo for dry and damaged hair is formulated to target excessive dryness and damage by providing extra moisture and nourishment. This type of shampoo often uses ingredients that are rich in vitamins, amino acids, minerals and oils to help repair the hair strands back to health. Additionally, these shampoos are free of harsh chemicals or sulfates that can further weaken already fragile strands. The result is smoother, softer, shinier hair with improved manageability.

Shampoo for Oily Hair and Scalp

Shampoo for oily hair is specially formulated to help reduce excess oil and sebum on the scalp. It uses ingredients that help break down the oil, while gently cleansing away dirt and impurities. It also helps unclog hair follicles, which can be a source of greasiness. Additionally, it contains balancing agents that help regulate the production of sebum on the scalp to prevent over-producing oils in the future. This type of shampoo works to leave your hair refreshed without stripping away its natural moisture or leaving behind a heavy residue.
